@graph.caption: Vegan aguachile verde on a blue talavera plate on top of a melon colored cloth napkin.

@graph.name: Vegan Aguachile Verde Recipe « Dora's Table
@graph.description: Vegan Aguachile Verde recipe, in this vegan version oyster mushrooms are used to replace the shrimp. Serve with tostadas and avocado.

@graph.name: Dora S.
@graph.description: Dora is the founder, recipe developer, and photographer at Dora's Table and Mi Mero Mole. Born and raised in Mexico and a graduate of the Culinary Institute of America in New York, she adopted a vegan (plant-based) diet to take control of her health.

@graph.name: Vegan Aguachile Verde (Aguachile Estilo Nayarit)
@graph.description: Vegan Aguachile Verde recipe, in this vegan version oyster mushrooms, are used to replace the shrimp. Serve with tostadas and avocado.
recipeIngredient: 7-8  King Oyster Mushrooms, medium size ((about 1.25 lb.))
3  Small seaweed sheets crumpled and sprinkled before serving

itemListElement.text: Clean mushrooms with a damp towel, do not wash since it will change the texture of the mushroom. Cut the mushroom stems, you can cut the top as well but I like the texture
itemListElement.name: Clean mushrooms with a damp towel, do not wash since it will change the texture of the mushroom. Cut the mushroom stems, you can cut the top as well but I like the texture

itemListElement.text: Shred them with two forks so they have a "shredded chicken" look. Place them in a large bowl, and marinate with 4-5 squeezed limes and pink salt, refrigerate for about 4 hours (I marinated mine over night.)
itemListElement.name: Shred them with two forks so they have a "shredded chicken" look. Place them in a large bowl, and marinate with 4-5 squeezed limes and pink salt, refrigerate for about 4 hours (I marinated mine over night.)

itemListElement.text: Place the serrano peppers, garlic, onion, juice of 4 limes, and cilantro in the blender and process until smooth.
itemListElement.name: Place the serrano peppers, garlic, onion, juice of 4 limes, and cilantro in the blender and process until smooth.

itemListElement.text: Cut the cucumbers in half and gut the cucumber so they resemble a “c” shape, slice thinly. Cut the onion into thin slices. Add cucumbers and onions to a large bowl.
itemListElement.name: Cut the cucumbers in half and gut the cucumber so they resemble a “c” shape, slice thinly. Cut the onion into thin slices. Add cucumbers and onions to a large bowl.

itemListElement.text: Pour serrano salsa over the cucumber/onion mix. Marinate for 2 – 4 hours. (I marinated it overnight.) Squeeze additional lime juice if needed, I like it very citrusy but this is optional.
itemListElement.name: Pour serrano salsa over the cucumber/onion mix. Marinate for 2 – 4 hours. (I marinated it overnight.) Squeeze additional lime juice if needed, I like it very citrusy but this is optional.

itemListElement.text: After the marinating time is done, combine mushrooms and cucumber/onion mix, add salt to taste, and top with avocado and extra cilantro.
itemListElement.name: After the marinating time is done, combine mushrooms and cucumber/onion mix, add salt to taste, and top with avocado and extra cilantro.

itemListElement.text: I like to add my seaweed right before serving so it doesn't get too soggy.
itemListElement.name: I like to add my seaweed right before serving so it doesn't get too soggy.
